analysis_notes.context: September 30, 2024 - Bilal reviewing sustainable construction curriculum he developed for BEIT (Building Equitable and Inclusive Transformation) project in Iraq. Partnership: ITC (International Trade Centre - UN/WTO joint agency), UN-Habitat, ILO. Four modules: (1) Sustainable Foundations for Iraq's Future, (2) Site Analysis & Planning, (3) Sustainable Materials, (4) Climate-Resilient Design + Hackathon. Target: young people and women. Goals: affordable housing, climate-smart construction, trade-led private sector growth. Creating expert feedback forms for validation, seeking government certification. 8 messages focused on document improvement and validation methodology.
analysis_notes.key_insight: This shows Bilal as INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT CONSULTANT applying Bloom's curriculum design methodology to Iraq context. Key design principles: (1) Modular + synergistic (flexibility + progression), (2) Hands-on + theory balance, (3) Iraq-specific relevance (not generic Western import), (4) Beginner-appropriate (youth/women with limited construction background), (5) Triple bottom line (social + environmental + economic), (6) Government certification pathway (institutional sustainability). The Iraq relevance question is CRITICAL - shows awareness of avoiding educational imperialism, contextualizing for local climate/materials/culture/post-conflict realities. This is Book F (Cross-Cultural Education Design) in action.
analysis_notes.cross_conversation_patterns: Conv 10 (Feb 2023 PERMAH frameworks): Researching assessment frameworks for Bloom. THIS (Sept 2024): Applying curriculum design to Iraq. Conv 12 (Dec 2024 organizational evaluation): Assessing 10 organizations for selection. THIS: Creating expert validation forms for curriculum. Conv 13 (April 2025 Baraka Economics): Struggling with Bloom vision. THIS (Sept 2024): Executing Bloom-style work successfully for ITC/UN. Timeline shows: Sept 2024 = successful delivery, April 2025 = existential crisis. What changed? PATTERN: Bilal strong on execution when working FOR clients (ITC, UN) on defined scope (curriculum development). Struggles when self-directed (Baraka Economics book, Bloom strategy).
